messageBody:
--- Eugene Kuleshov <eu@m...> wrote:
> Anyway, it does work fine if you set a breakpoint in the
> code or exception breakpoint, then code can be replaced.
> However I have hard time to rerun test cases created by my
> suite method. You are right that with "keep junit running"
> option in debug mode "Run" action does not fail, but it
> does not execute the test either. I've added tracing to the
> test method and it is just not being called. I still wonder
> what am I doing wrong here?
>
> I am using Eclipse 3.2M1...

I think you're right. For me, it works (and runs the code!) when
rerunning individual test method instances /that were found using
the standard TestSuite(TestCase) constructor/. But for dynamically
generated test cases, it doesn't rerun them. Looks like an Eclipse
bug to me.



(For lurkers: The Eclipse "Keep JUnit running after a test run when
debugging" option is on the run configuration screen. Menu: "Run ->
Run..."; not "Windows -> Preferences -> ...")
